meanings.definition: A type of box or case used for storing papers or specimens.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully placed the delicate butterfly specimen in the solanders.
meanings.sent2: The librarian organized the important documents in the solanders for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the stack of solanders, sending papers flying everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a solanders of memories, neatly stored and preserved.
meanings.sent5: The solanders stood tall on the shelf, guarding their precious contents.

meanings.definition: Plural form of solander, referring to multiple solander boxes or cases.
meanings.sent1: The office was filled with solanders, each holding a different collection of items.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a row of solanders, showcasing various artifacts and specimens.
meanings.sent3: The solanders lined up like soldiers, ready to protect their valuable contents.
meanings.sent4: The solanders stood out in the room, each one a treasure trove waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The solanders whispered secrets of the past, waiting to be discovered by curious minds.
